title: Luke Chapter 21 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Luke chapter 21 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Luke Chapter 21 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Luke Chapter 21.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say gave more than all the others when casting gifts into the treasury?
options: A certain poor widow
The rich men
The priests
The disciples
questions.correctAnswer: A certain poor widow
questions.explanation: Jesus said that the poor widow cast in more than all because she gave all she had, as stated in Luke 21:3.

questions.question: What did the poor widow cast into the treasury?
options: Two mites
One silver coin
A loaf of bread
Five gold coins
questions.correctAnswer: Two mites
questions.explanation: The poor widow cast in two mites, which were very small coins, as mentioned in Luke 21:2.

questions.question: What will happen to the stones of the temple according to Jesus?
options: Not one stone will be left upon another
The stones will shine brightly
The stones will multiply
The stones will be hidden underground
questions.correctAnswer: Not one stone will be left upon another
questions.explanation: Jesus foretold that the temple would be destroyed so that not one stone would remain upon another as per Luke 21:6.

questions.question: What warning did Jesus give about people coming in His name?
options: Do not follow them
Follow them closely
Ignore them silently
Write down their teachings
questions.correctAnswer: Do not follow them
questions.explanation: Jesus warned to take heed and not be deceived by those who come saying 'I am Christ', as in Luke 21:8.

questions.question: According to Luke 21, what should you not be terrified of when hearing about wars and commotions?
options: These things must first come to pass
They will immediately end the world
They are signs to hide
They mean peace is near
questions.correctAnswer: These things must first come to pass
questions.explanation: Jesus explained that wars and commotions are events that must happen first and the end is not immediate, as in Luke 21:9.

questions.question: What are some of the signs mentioned that will occur before the end?
options: Earthquakes, famines, pestilences, and fearful sights
Rainbows and calm seas
Peace treaties and harvests
No signs will occur
questions.correctAnswer: Earthquakes, famines, pestilences, and fearful sights
questions.explanation: Jesus listed these signs as indications before the end, in Luke 21:11.

questions.question: Who will persecute Jesus' followers before these events happen?
options: Kings, rulers, synagogues, and prisons
Only strangers
No one will persecute them
Animals and nature
questions.correctAnswer: Kings, rulers, synagogues, and prisons
questions.explanation: Jesus said that believers will be persecuted and delivered up to synagogues, prisons, and rulers as in Luke 21:12.

questions.question: What will Jesus give to believers when they are brought before adversaries?
options: A mouth and wisdom
A sword and shield
Wealth and power
Silence and fear
questions.correctAnswer: A mouth and wisdom
questions.explanation: Jesus promised to give wisdom and ability to speak so adversaries cannot resist or contradict, as found in Luke 21:15.

questions.question: According to Luke 21, who will betray Jesus' followers?
options: Parents, brethren, kinsfolks, and friends
Only strangers
No one will betray them
Only government officials
questions.correctAnswer: Parents, brethren, kinsfolks, and friends
questions.explanation: Jesus said that believers will be betrayed by even those closest to them, as stated in Luke 21:16.

questions.question: What will happen to believers' heads during the persecution?
options: Not one hair will perish
They will lose all their hair
They will be marked
They will be hidden
questions.correctAnswer: Not one hair will perish
questions.explanation: Jesus assured that no hair of their head will perish despite persecution, as in Luke 21:18.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said to flee to the mountains when Jerusalem is surrounded by armies.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus instructed those in Judaea to flee to the mountains when Jerusalem is compassed with armies (Luke 21:21).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that the days of vengeance are to fulfill all that was written.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 21:22 states these days of vengeance fulfill all written prophecy.

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 21, there will be distress and wrath upon the people, especially affecting women with children and nursing mothers.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 21:23 warns of great distress and wrath, particularly for women with child and nursing mothers.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with _____ and great glory.'
options: power
peace
mercy
love
questions.correctAnswer: power
questions.explanation: Luke 21:27 says the Son of man will come with power and great glory.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'Watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the ____ __ ____. '
options: Son of man
Holy Spirit
King of kings
Father above
questions.correctAnswer: Son of man
questions.explanation: Luke 21:36 instructs believers to watch and pray to stand before the Son of man.

medium.title: Luke Chapter 21 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Luke Chapter 21 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with feelings of insignificance in their giving. Based on Luke 21, what biblical truth about generosity would you share?
options: The smallest gift given in faith is more valuable than large offerings from abundance
Only rich people are truly generous because they give more
Giving is only valuable when it is done publicly
The amount given is more important than the heart behind it
questions.correctAnswer: The smallest gift given in faith is more valuable than large offerings from abundance
questions.explanation: Luke 21:2-4 teaches us that the poor widow's small gift, given out of her poverty, was worth more than the large offerings of the rich because she gave all she had. This shows the value of sacrificial giving and the heart behind generosity.

questions.question: How does Luke 21 teach us to respond when facing persecution for our faith?
options: Trust that God will give you wisdom and words to speak
Avoid all confrontation and remain silent
Retaliate against those who persecute you
Hide your faith to avoid trouble
questions.correctAnswer: Trust that God will give you wisdom and words to speak
questions.explanation: Luke 21:12-15 assures believers that when they are persecuted, God will give them wisdom and a mouth that their adversaries cannot resist, encouraging trust and boldness in trials.

questions.question: According to Luke 21, what attitude should believers maintain during times of distress and trials?
options: Patience and endurance
Fear and anxiety
Indifference
Anger and bitterness
questions.correctAnswer: Patience and endurance
questions.explanation: Luke 21:19 instructs believers to possess their souls in patience during trials, emphasizing endurance and calm trust in God's plan.

questions.question: How does Luke 21 encourage believers to prepare for the coming challenges and the return of Christ?
options: By watching, praying, and living with spiritual alertness
By ignoring the signs and focusing on daily life
By accumulating wealth and possessions
By isolating themselves from others
questions.correctAnswer: By watching, praying, and living with spiritual alertness
questions.explanation: Luke 21:36 teaches the importance of watching and praying always so that believers may be counted worthy to escape difficult times and stand before the Son of Man, highlighting spiritual vigilance and prayer.

questions.question: A believer is concerned about how to respond when false teachers claim to be Christ. What advice does Luke 21 provide?
options: Do not follow them because deception will increase
Accept their teachings as long as they seem sincere
Ignore all teachings about the end times
Follow whoever proclaims the coming of the kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: Do not follow them because deception will increase
questions.explanation: Luke 21:8 warns believers to be cautious of many who will come in Jesus’ name claiming to be Christ and urges not to follow them, teaching discernment and faithfulness to the true gospel.

questions.question: What does Luke 21 say about the signs that will precede the coming of the Son of Man?
options: There will be signs in the sun, moon, stars, and distress among nations
There will be peace and prosperity everywhere
No signs will be visible before His coming
Only personal, private revelations will signal His return
questions.correctAnswer: There will be signs in the sun, moon, stars, and distress among nations
questions.explanation: Luke 21:25-26 describes cosmic signs and distress among nations as part of the events before the Son of Man’s coming, indicating visible, public signs of the times.

questions.question: Based on Luke 21, how should Christians view the destruction of Jerusalem and the distress that follows?
options: As days of vengeance fulfilling Scripture and a warning to flee
As a reason to abandon faith
As a minor event with no spiritual significance
As proof that God has rejected His people forever
questions.correctAnswer: As days of vengeance fulfilling Scripture and a warning to flee
questions.explanation: Luke 21:20-22 advises believers to recognize Jerusalem surrounded by armies as a sign to flee because these are days of vengeance fulfilling Scripture, encouraging obedience and awareness.

questions.question: True or False: Luke 21 teaches that believers will be hated by all people because of their faith in Christ.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 21:17 clearly states that believers will be hated by all men for Jesus’ name’s sake, indicating the reality of opposition and persecution.

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 21, the words of Jesus will eventually pass away along with heaven and earth.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 21:33 affirms that heaven and earth will pass away, but Jesus’ words will never pass away, emphasizing the eternal authority and reliability of His teaching.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Luke 21 encourages believers to "watch ye therefore, and ____ always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things."
options: pray
fight
rest
work
questions.correctAnswer: pray
questions.explanation: Luke 21:36 instructs believers to watch and pray always so that they may be counted worthy to escape coming trials and stand before the Son of Man, highlighting prayer as a vital spiritual discipline.

questions.question: In what way does Luke 21 teach about the importance of not being anxious about how to defend oneself when persecuted?
options: God will give you wisdom and words at the time of need
You must memorize arguments beforehand
Avoid persecution by denying your faith
Hire legal counsel to defend you
questions.correctAnswer: God will give you wisdom and words at the time of need
questions.explanation: Luke 21:14-15 encourages believers to not premeditate their defense because God will provide wisdom and words that adversaries cannot resist, teaching reliance on God’s provision.

questions.question: How does Luke 21 describe the betrayal believers may face from those close to them?
options: Betrayed by parents, brethren, kinsfolks, and friends
Betrayed only by strangers
Never betrayed by family or friends
Betrayed only by religious leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Betrayed by parents, brethren, kinsfolks, and friends
questions.explanation: Luke 21:16 states that believers will be betrayed even by close family and friends, highlighting the cost of discipleship and need for perseverance.

questions.question: What practical advice does Luke 21 give for believers when they see 'Jerusalem compassed with armies'?
options: Flee to the mountains and avoid entering the city
Stay in the city and pray for peace
Join the armies to defend Jerusalem
Ignore the signs and continue daily life
questions.correctAnswer: Flee to the mountains and avoid entering the city
questions.explanation: Luke 21:20-21 instructs those in Judea to flee to the mountains when Jerusalem is surrounded by armies, a practical call for safety and obedience to God’s warning.

questions.question: What does the parable of the fig tree in Luke 21 teach us about recognizing the times and kingdom of God?
options: When you see the signs, know the kingdom of God is near
The fig tree only relates to agricultural matters
The kingdom of God will come without any signs
The parable encourages ignoring worldly events
questions.correctAnswer: When you see the signs, know the kingdom of God is near
questions.explanation: Luke 21:29-31 uses the fig tree shooting forth leaves as a sign that summer is near, teaching believers to recognize the signs of the times and the nearness of God's kingdom.

questions.question: According to Luke 21, what will happen to those who are with child or nursing during the days of great distress?
options: They will face great woe and distress
They will be specially protected
They will be unaffected by the events
They will be taken to safety automatically
questions.correctAnswer: They will face great woe and distress
questions.explanation: Luke 21:23 warns of great distress and woe for those with child or nursing, highlighting the severity of the coming trials and the need for compassion and prayer.

hard.title: Luke Chapter 21 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Luke Chapter 21.

questions.question: What did Jesus observe about the poor widow's offering compared to the rich men in Luke 21?
options: She gave more than all the rich men because she gave all she had
She gave less than the rich men because she was poor
She gave the same amount as the rich men
She refused to give anything
questions.correctAnswer: She gave more than all the rich men because she gave all she had
questions.explanation: Luke 21:3-4 explains Jesus' observation that the poor widow, though giving only two mites, gave more than the rich because she gave all she had out of her poverty.

questions.question: According to Luke 21, what will happen to the temple that people admired for its stones and gifts?
options: Not one stone will be left upon another
It will be glorified and expanded
It will be relocated to another city
It will be preserved forever
questions.correctAnswer: Not one stone will be left upon another
questions.explanation: In Luke 21:6, Jesus predicts the destruction of the temple, stating that not one stone will remain upon another, indicating complete ruin.

questions.question: What warning does Jesus give about those who come in His name saying, 'I am Christ'?
options: Do not follow them because they are deceivers
They will perform miracles to prove their identity
They will lead the faithful to safety
They will be recognized and accepted by all
questions.correctAnswer: Do not follow them because they are deceivers
questions.explanation: Luke 21:8 warns believers to beware of deception from many who will falsely claim to be Christ and to avoid following them.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a sign preceding the end times in Luke 21?
options: Wars and commotions
Great earthquakes
Famines and pestilences
The rebuilding of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The rebuilding of the temple
questions.explanation: Luke 21:9-11 lists wars, earthquakes, famines, and pestilences as signs but does not mention the rebuilding of the temple as a sign.

questions.question: What does Jesus say will happen to his followers before these signs come to pass?
options: They will be persecuted and brought before rulers for His name's sake
They will be given worldly power and wealth
They will be hidden from all troubles
They will establish a new temple
questions.correctAnswer: They will be persecuted and brought before rulers for His name's sake
questions.explanation: Luke 21:12 describes how Jesus' followers will face persecution, imprisonment, and trials before the end signs occur.

questions.question: According to Luke 21, what will Jesus provide to those who are persecuted to help them respond?
options: A mouth and wisdom that adversaries cannot resist
Physical strength to overcome enemies
Magic signs and wonders
A secret escape route
questions.correctAnswer: A mouth and wisdom that adversaries cannot resist
questions.explanation: Luke 21:15 promises that Jesus will give wisdom and words to believers so their adversaries cannot refute them during persecution.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Luke 21:16 says, 'And ye shall be betrayed both by parents, and brethren, and kinsfolks, and _______'?
options: friends
strangers
priests
kings
questions.correctAnswer: friends
questions.explanation: The verse Luke 21:16 specifically lists 'friends' as one of the groups who will betray believers.

questions.question: What assurance does Jesus give about the safety of His followers during times of great persecution?
options: Not a hair of your head will perish
You will be physically unharmed
You will be immediately rescued
You will not face any hardships
questions.correctAnswer: Not a hair of your head will perish
questions.explanation: In Luke 21:18, Jesus assures His followers that despite persecution, not even a hair on their heads will be lost, signifying divine protection.

questions.question: What does Jesus instruct those in Judea to do when they see Jerusalem surrounded by armies?
options: Flee to the mountains
Stay and defend the city
Seek peace with the invading armies
Pray silently and wait
questions.correctAnswer: Flee to the mountains
questions.explanation: Luke 21:21 commands those in Judea to flee to the mountains when Jerusalem is besieged, indicating imminent desolation.

questions.question: True or False: Luke 21 mentions that Jerusalem will be trampled by Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 21:24 clearly states that Jerusalem will be trodden down by Gentiles until the appointed times are fulfilled.

questions.question: What cosmic signs does Jesus mention that will accompany the distress of nations in the last days?
options: Signs in the sun, moon, and stars
A new star appearing in the sky
Eclipses every month
The moon turning red for a week
questions.correctAnswer: Signs in the sun, moon, and stars
questions.explanation: Luke 21:25 describes signs appearing in the sun, moon, and stars as part of the apocalyptic events.

questions.question: How does Luke 21 describe the reaction of people's hearts to the coming powers of heaven being shaken?
options: Their hearts will fail them for fear and perplexity
They will rejoice and celebrate
They will become indifferent
They will organize a resistance
questions.correctAnswer: Their hearts will fail them for fear and perplexity
questions.explanation: Luke 21:26 explains that people’s hearts will fail them due to fear and confusion over the coming cosmic disturbances.

questions.question: What event does Luke 21:27 say people will see involving the Son of Man?
options: The Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory
The Son of Man descending as a lamb
The Son of Man appearing as a humble servant
The Son of Man leading an army
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory
questions.explanation: Luke 21:27 foretells the visible return of the Son of Man in glory and power on a cloud.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the parable of the fig tree and all the trees in Luke 21?
options: When trees put forth leaves, summer is near; similarly, when signs appear, the kingdom of God is near
The fig tree represents Israel's prosperity
The trees symbolize the nations at war
The fig tree parable predicts the destruction of Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: When trees put forth leaves, summer is near; similarly, when signs appear, the kingdom of God is near
questions.explanation: Luke 21:29-31 explains that just as seeing leaves on trees indicates summer is near, seeing these signs means the kingdom of God is close.

questions.question: What admonition does Jesus give in Luke 21:34-36 regarding the attitudes believers should avoid to be ready for the day of the Son of Man?
options: Avoid being overcharged with surfeiting, drunkenness, and cares of this life; watch and pray always
Avoid fasting and prayer
Avoid gathering in communities
Avoid sharing the gospel publicly
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid being overcharged with surfeiting, drunkenness, and cares of this life; watch and pray always
questions.explanation: Luke 21:34-36 warns believers not to be distracted by excess and worldly cares but to be watchful and prayerful to stand before the Son of Man.

theological.title: Luke Chapter 21 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Luke Chapter 21 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Luke 21, what did Jesus say about the poor widow who cast in two mites?
options: She gave more than all the rich because she gave all she had
She gave less than the rich because her offering was small
She was praised for giving the exact amount required by the law
She was criticized for giving too little
questions.correctAnswer: She gave more than all the rich because she gave all she had
questions.explanation: Jesus noted that the poor widow gave more than the rich because she gave all she had, demonstrating sacrificial giving (Luke 21:3-4). This reflects the biblical principle that God values the heart and sacrifice of giving (Mark 12:41-44; 2 Corinthians 8:2-3; Proverbs 3:9; Malachi 3:10).

questions.question: What prophecy did Jesus give concerning the temple and its stones?
options: Not one stone will be left upon another; all will be thrown down
The temple will be rebuilt and glorified forever
The stones will shine like the stars in the sky
The temple will be hidden until the end times
questions.correctAnswer: Not one stone will be left upon another; all will be thrown down
questions.explanation: Jesus foretold the destruction of the temple, indicating a complete demolition where no stone would remain on another (Luke 21:6). This prophecy aligns with historical fulfillment in AD 70 (Matthew 24:2; Mark 13:2; Daniel 9:26; Jeremiah 7:14).

questions.question: Jesus warns in Luke 21 to beware of what kind of deception?
options: Many will come in His name claiming to be Christ
False prophets preaching peace only
False teachers denying resurrection
People claiming the end is already here
questions.correctAnswer: Many will come in His name claiming to be Christ
questions.explanation: Jesus warned that many would come claiming to be the Christ and deceive many, cautioning believers not to follow them (Luke 21:8). This is consistent with warnings in Matthew 24:5, 23-24; 2 Thessalonians 2:3-4; 1 John 4:1; and Acts 20:29-30.

questions.question: What signs did Jesus mention as preceding the end times?
options: Wars, earthquakes, famines, pestilences, and fearful wonders from heaven
Peace and prosperity throughout all nations
The rebuilding of the temple in Jerusalem
A global revival of faith and righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Wars, earthquakes, famines, pestilences, and fearful wonders from heaven
questions.explanation: Jesus outlined various calamities as signs preceding the end, including wars, natural disasters, and heavenly signs (Luke 21:9-11). This list aligns with similar apocalyptic imagery in Matthew 24:6-8; Mark 13:7-8; Revelation 6:12-14; and Joel 2:30-31.

questions.question: According to Luke 21, what will happen to Jesus' followers before these end-time events?
options: They will be persecuted, betrayed, and brought before rulers
They will be granted immunity from suffering
They will lead armies to conquer nations
They will build a new temple
questions.correctAnswer: They will be persecuted, betrayed, and brought before rulers
questions.explanation: Jesus explained that His followers would face persecution, betrayal by family and friends, imprisonment, and trials before authorities (Luke 21:12-17). This teaching is echoed in Matthew 10:16-22; John 15:20; 2 Timothy 3:12; and Acts 14:22.

questions.question: What promise did Jesus give to those who will be persecuted and brought before rulers?
options: He will give them a mouth and wisdom that their adversaries cannot resist
They will be saved by miracles performed on their behalf
They will escape all trials without harm
They will be supported by earthly armies
questions.correctAnswer: He will give them a mouth and wisdom that their adversaries cannot resist
questions.explanation: Jesus promised divine wisdom and eloquence to His followers so that adversaries could not refute them during trials (Luke 21:15). Similar assurances are found in Matthew 10:19-20; Mark 13:11; Exodus 4:12; and Isaiah 50:4.

questions.question: In Luke 21, what is said about the fate of Jesus' followers who are hated for His name's sake?
options: Not a hair of their head will perish
They will all be martyred
They will lose their faith
They will be abandoned by God
questions.correctAnswer: Not a hair of their head will perish
questions.explanation: Despite persecution and hatred, Jesus assured believers that not a single hair on their heads will perish, emphasizing God's protection (Luke 21:18). This reflects God's sovereign care in Psalm 34:19; Isaiah 43:2; Romans 8:35-39; and 1 Peter 3:14.

questions.question: What event does Jesus describe in Luke 21 as a sign that Jerusalem's desolation is near?
options: Jerusalem surrounded by armies
A great earthquake in the city
The rebuilding of the temple altar
A worldwide peace treaty
questions.correctAnswer: Jerusalem surrounded by armies
questions.explanation: Jesus stated that when Jerusalem is surrounded by armies, the time for its desolation is near (Luke 21:20). This prophecy was historically fulfilled in the Roman siege of Jerusalem (Matthew 24:15-16; Mark 13:14; Jeremiah 52:6-7; 2 Kings 25:1-3).

questions.question: What instruction does Jesus give to those in Judea when they see Jerusalem surrounded by armies?
options: Flee to the mountains and avoid entering the city
Gather in the temple to pray for peace
Join the defenders of the city
Hide within the city walls
questions.correctAnswer: Flee to the mountains and avoid entering the city
questions.explanation: Jesus instructed those in Judea to flee to the mountains and those in the city to depart, warning against entering the city during this time of judgment (Luke 21:21). This echoes Old Testament calls to escape impending judgment (Jeremiah 51:6; Ezekiel 12:14; Revelation 18:4; Matthew 24:17-18).

questions.question: What does Luke 21 say will happen to Jerusalem until 'the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled'?
options: It will be trodden down by the Gentiles
It will be restored as the capital of Israel
It will be hidden from all nations
It will become a center for global worship
questions.correctAnswer: It will be trodden down by the Gentiles
questions.explanation: The chapter states Jerusalem will be oppressed and trampled by Gentiles until their appointed time is fulfilled (Luke 21:24). This theme appears in Daniel 7:25; Zechariah 14:2; Romans 11:25; and Revelation 11:2.

questions.question: Which cosmic signs does Luke 21 mention as accompanying the distress of nations before the Son of Man's coming?
options: Signs in the sun, moon, and stars with perplexity on earth
Darkness covering the whole world with no stars visible
A new star appearing brighter than the sun
The earth opening up and swallowing cities
questions.correctAnswer: Signs in the sun, moon, and stars with perplexity on earth
questions.explanation: Jesus described celestial disturbances and earthly distress as signs preceding His return (Luke 21:25). Similar imagery is found in Joel 2:30-31; Matthew 24:29; Revelation 6:12-14; and Isaiah 13:10.

questions.question: How does Luke 21 describe people's reactions to the coming events and powers being shaken?
options: Men's hearts will fail them for fear and perplexity
People will celebrate and rejoice
Everyone will be indifferent and unaware
Leaders will unite to establish peace
questions.correctAnswer: Men's hearts will fail them for fear and perplexity
questions.explanation: The chapter states that people's hearts will fail them due to fear and the anticipation of catastrophic events (Luke 21:26). This aligns with descriptions in Revelation 6:15-17; Isaiah 13:7-8; Ezekiel 7:25; and Psalm 46:2-3.

questions.question: What does Luke 21 say about the coming of the Son of Man?
options: He will come in a cloud with power and great glory
He will come quietly and unnoticed
He will come as a baby in Bethlehem
He will come only in the hearts of believers
questions.correctAnswer: He will come in a cloud with power and great glory
questions.explanation: Jesus declared His return will be visible and glorious, coming on clouds with power (Luke 21:27). This is affirmed in Daniel 7:13; Matthew 24:30; Revelation 1:7; and Acts 1:9-11.

questions.question: What does Jesus urge believers to do when they see the signs and events beginning to take place?
options: Look up and lift up your heads for your redemption is near
Hide and avoid all public places
Doubt and question the prophecies
Disregard the signs and continue as usual
questions.correctAnswer: Look up and lift up your heads for your redemption is near
questions.explanation: Jesus encourages believers to be hopeful and confident, recognizing that their redemption is near when these signs occur (Luke 21:28). This is consistent with Romans 8:23-25; 1 Thessalonians 4:16-18; Isaiah 40:31; and 2 Corinthians 5:1.

questions.question: What lesson does Jesus teach through the parable of the fig tree and other trees in Luke 21?
options: When they bud, it shows summer is near, so when signs appear, the kingdom of God is near
The fig tree will wither before the end comes
Trees represent false teachers to be avoided
The fig tree is a symbol of Israel's restoration
questions.correctAnswer: When they bud, it shows summer is near, so when signs appear, the kingdom of God is near
questions.explanation: Jesus uses the fig tree's budding as a natural sign to illustrate that when prophetic signs appear, the kingdom of God is near (Luke 21:29-31). This teaching relates to Matthew 24:32-34; Mark 13:28-30; Hosea 9:10; and Jeremiah 24:3.
